page.title: 02THE PIER HERNE BAY (part 1)
page.content: Although most of this Domesday Block is easily dismissed as 'sea', one feature in this is the old pier head cafe now standing in isolation 3,800 feet from the shore. One of Herne Bay's few claims to fame was it possessed the World's second longest pier which stretched for 3/4 of a mile. There was little of note on this pier except for a large pavilion near the shore and at the end of the pier was a cafe built in Victorian times. Up till 1960 an old paddle steamer took passengers across to Southend which had the World's longest pier. After 1960 the pier was mainly used by anglers and it was also a pleasant walk. In 1970 the old pier pavilion was destroyed by fire and the new sports complex was built to take its place. Soon after this opened the seaward section of the pier was deemed
